description.para: The enumeration Locate_type is defined to specify which case occurs when locating a point in the triangulation.

briefdescription.para: Size type (integral unsigned).

The following iterator and circulator types are defined to give access over hyperbolic faces and edges:

briefdescription.para: Default constructor
Copy constructor.
Equivalent to creating an empty triangulation and calling insert(first, last).
The triangulation tr is duplicated, and modifying the copy after the duplication does not modify the original.
The triangulation is swapped with tr.
Deletes all vertices and faces of the triangulation.

Returns a const reference to the geometric traits object.

Returns a reference to the triangulation data structure.
Checks the combinatorial validity of the triangulation, the validity of its geometric embedding, and also that all edges and faces are Delaunay hyperbolic.
Returns the dimension of the affine hull.
Returns the number of vertices.
Returns the number of hyperbolic edges.
Returns the number of hyperbolic faces.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Face_handle f, const int i) const
memberdef.name: hyperbolic_segment

briefdescription.para: Returns the hyperbolic segment formed by the vertices of the edge (f, i).
Returns the hyperbolic segment formed by the vertices of edge e.
Inserts the point p in the triangulation.

detaileddescription.para: If the point p coincides with an existing vertex, then the vertex is returned and the triangulation is not modified. The optional parameter start is used to initialize the location of p.

briefdescription.para: Inserts the points in the range [first,last) into the triangulation.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of inserted points. Note that this function is not guaranteed to insert the points following the order of InputIterator, as spatial_sort() is used to improve efficiency.

parameterdescription.para: must be an input iterator with the value type Point.

briefdescription.para: Removes the vertex v from the triangulation.

simplesect.para: v is a vertex of the triangulation.

briefdescription.para: Removes the vertices in the iterator range [first, last) from the triangulation.

simplesect.para: all vertices in [first, last) are vertices of the triangulation.

briefdescription.para: Locates the point query in the triangulation.

detaileddescription.para: If the point query lies inside the hyperbolic convex hull of the points of the triangulation, then the hyperbolic face that contains the query in its interior is returned.

If query lies on a vertex or on an edge, then one of the faces having query on its boundary is returned. Todo
verify case when query lies on dangling edge!
If query lies outside of the convex hull of the points of the triangulation, then a default-constructed Face_handle() is returned.
The optional argument hint is used as a starting place for the search.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &query, Locate_type &lt, int &li, Face_handle hint=Face_handle()) const
memberdef.name: locate

briefdescription.para: Same as above.

detaileddescription.para: The variable lt contains information about the element in which query has been located. See the enumeration Locate_type for details.
If lt is Locate_type::VERTEX, then the variable li contains the index of the vertex in the returned face. If lt is Locate_type::EDGE, then li is the index of the edge in the returned face.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Point &p, OutputItFaces fit, Face_handle start=Face_handle()) const
memberdef.name: find_conflicts

briefdescription.para: Computes the conflict zone induced by p.

detaileddescription.para: If the optional parameter start is given, then it must be a face in conflict with p. Returns an iterator on the faces of the triangulation in conflict with p.

sectiondef.header: Vertex, Face and Edge iterators and circulators

description.para: Users should use a kernel with exact constructions in order to guarantee the computation of the Voronoi diagram (as opposed to computing the triangulation only, which requires only exact predicates).

briefdescription.para: Returns the hyperbolic center of the circumdisk of f.
Returns the hyperbolic segment that is dual to e.
Returns the hyperbolic segment that is dual to the edge (f,i).
The class Hyperbolic_Delaunay_triangulation_2 is the main class of the 2D Hyperbolic Delaunay Triangulations package.

detaileddescription.para: It is designed to represent Delaunay triangulations of sets of points in the hyperbolic plane. The hyperbolic plane is represented in the Poincar disk model.

parameterdescription.para: is the geometric traits class and must be a model of HyperbolicDelaunayTriangulationTraits_2.

is the triangulation graph data structure and must be a model of TriangulationDataStructure_2 whose vertex and face are models of TriangulationVertexBase_2 and HyperbolicTriangulationFaceBase_2, respectively. It defaults to: CGAL::Triangulation_data_structure_2< CGAL::Triangulation_vertex_base_2<Gt>, CGAL::Hyperbolic_triangulation_face_base_2<Gt>>
